sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Earle of Darby's speech on the scaffold, immediately before his execution at Bolton in Lancashire, on Wednesday, October 15. 1651. Exactly taken in short-hand, as it was spoken; and now published for the satisfaction of those that desire to be truly informed. Derby, James Stanley, Earl of, 1607-1651.
7, [1] p.
Printed for Nathaniel Brooks, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Angel in Cornhil, London : 1651.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

7, [1] p.
Printed for Nathaniel Brooks, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Angel in Cornhil, London : 1651.
